attributeReference.name: universityFiscalYear
attributeReference.label: Fiscal Year
attributeReference.description: This identifies the fiscal year of this object code. The Kuali object code table is by fiscal year, which assists in clean-up and maitenance of object codes.

attribute.name: financialObjectCode
attribute.label: Object Code
attribute.description: The code for the "object" of accounting for a transaction, expressed as a 4-digit numeric text, including leading zeros. For Search Criteria, select the Help for the Object Code Lookup title.

attribute.name: financialObjectCodeName
attribute.label: Object Code Name
attribute.description: A description that conveys the concept represented by the Object Code. For Search Criteria, select the Help for the Object Code Lookup title.

attribute.name: financialObjectCodeShortName
attribute.label: Object Code Short Name
attribute.description: A shortened version of the Object Code Name for use on standard reports that have limited space available for printing. No additional functions have been assigned to this field. For Search Criteria, select the Help for the Object Code Lookup title.

attribute.name: financialObjectLevelCode
attribute.label: Object Level Code
attribute.description: The code used to aggregate Object Codes into a broader classification, expressed as a 4-character code. For Search Criteria, select the Help for the Object Code Lookup title.

attribute.name: reportsToFinancialObjectCode
attribute.label: Reports To Object Code
attribute.description: The Object Code in the chart higher than the current chart that this Object Code reports to.

attribute.name: financialObjectTypeCode
attribute.label: Object Type Code
attribute.description: The code used to identify the basic accounting category to which the Object Code relates, expressed as a 2-character code. For Search Criteria, select the Help for the Object Code Lookup title.

attribute.name: financialObjectSubTypeCode
attribute.label: Object Sub-Type Code
attribute.description: A classification for Object Codes used for system checking, routing, and approval, expressed as a 2-character code. For Search Criteria, select the Help for the Object Code Lookup title.

attribute.name: historicalFinancialObjectCode
attribute.label: Historical Financial Object Code
attribute.description: The code that links the current Object Code to codes used in the past to represent the same concept. It provides for the reference of a different code previously used for this purpose, and can be used for historical reporting.

attribute.name: financialObjectActiveIndicator
attribute.label: Active Code
attribute.description: Radioboxes in the entry form that indicate if the Object Code is active or inactive. If "Both" is checked in the Lookup, then both "Yes" (active) or "No" (inactive) values are listed in the search.

attribute.name: financialBudgetAggregationCd
attribute.label: Budget Aggregation Code
attribute.description: The code that indicates at what level the Object Code can be used for budgeting, expressed as a 1-character code, where O = Object Code level, C = consolidation level, and L = the level itself.

attribute.name: finObjMandatoryTrnfrOrElimCd
attribute.label: Mandatory Transfer Or Eliminations Code
attribute.description: The code to identify for a mandatory transfer code (M), elimination code (E), or neither (N). This value is used by the KFS for the application of business rules where mandatory transfer or elimination codes are either required or prohibited.

attribute.name: financialFederalFundedCode
attribute.label: Federal Funded Code
attribute.description: The indicator shows whether this is an Object Code for capital equipment is Federally Funded. Values include non-federally funded, university owned (N), federally funded, university owned (O), or federally funded, federally owned (F).

attribute.name: nextYearFinancialObjectCode
attribute.label: Next Year Object Code
attribute.description: Select the check box if this attribute allows the referencing of a subsequent year code in a previous chart year. Clear the check box if it does not.
